name: Aryabhatta
description: India's first satellite.

name: Bhaskara Sega-I
description: India's first experimental remote sensing satellite that carried TV and microwave cameras.

name: Rohini TechnologyPayload
description: The First Indian launch vehicle Failed to achieve orbit.

name: Rohini RS-1
description: India's first indigenous satellite launch, used for measuring the in-flight performance of the second experimental launch of SLV-3.

name: Rohini RS-D1
description: Launched by the first developmental launch of SLV-3, used for conducting remote sensing technology studies using a sensor payload.

name: Apple
description: First experimental communication satellite.

name: Bhaskara-II
description: Second experimental remote sensing satellite.

name: INSAT-1A
description: First operational multipurpose communication and meteorology satellite.

name: Rohini RS-D2
description: Identical to RS-D1.

name: INSAT-1B
description: Identical to INSAT-1A.

name: SROSS-1
description: It carried a payload for launch vehicle performance monitoring and for gamma-ray astronomy. Failed to achieve orbit.

name: IRS-1A
description: India's first operational remote sensing satellite.

name: SROSS-2
description: Carried remote sensing payload of the German space agency and gamma-ray astronomy payload.

name: INSAT-1C
description: Same as INSAT-1A.

name: INSAT-1D
description: Identical to INSAT-1A.

name: IRS-1B
description: Improved version of IRS-1A.

name: INSAT-2DT
description: Launched as Arabsat 1C.

name: SROSS-C
description: It carried gamma-ray astronomy and aeronomy payload.

name: INSAT-2A
description: The first satellite in the second-generation Indian-built INSAT-2 series.

name: INSAT-2B
description: The second satellite in the INSAT-2 series.

name: IRS-1E
description: Earth observation satellite. Failed to achieve orbit.

name: SROSS-C2
description: Identical to SROSS-C.

name: IRS-P2
description: Launched by the second developmental flight of PSLV.

name: INSAT-2C
description: It has capabilities such as mobile satellite service, business communication and television outreach beyond Indian boundaries.

name: IRS-1C
description: Launched from Baikonur Cosmodrome.

name: IRS-P3
description: It carried a remote sensing payload and an X-ray astronomy payload.

name: INSAT-2D
description: Same as INSAT-2C.

name: IRS-1D
description: Same as IRS-1C.

name: INSAT-2E
description: Multipurpose communication and meteorological satellite.

name: OceanSat-1
description: It carried an OCM and MSMR.

name: INSAT-3B
description: Multipurpose communication satellite.

name: GSAT-1
description: Experimental satellite for the first developmental flight of GSLV-D1. Failed to complete its mission.

name: TES
description: It is considered a prototype for future Indian spy satellites.

name: INSAT-3C
description: Augmented the INSAT capacity for communication and broadcasting

name: Kalpana-1
description: First meteorological satellite built by ISRO.

name: INSAT-3A
description: Multipurpose communication satellite, similar to INSAT-2E and Kalpana-1.

name: GSAT-2
description: Experimental satellite for the second developmental test flight of GSLV.

name: INSAT-3E
description: Communication satellite to augment the existing INSAT System.

name: ResourceSat-1
description: Intended to supplement and replace IRS-1C and IRS-1D.

name: GSAT-3
description: India's first exclusive educational satellite.

name: CartoSat-1
description: Earth observation satellite.

name: HamSat
description: Micro-satellite built in collaboration with Indian and Dutch researchers.

name: INSAT-4A
description: Advanced satellite for direct-to-home television broadcasting services.

name: INSAT-4C
description: Geosynchronous communications satellite. Failed to achieve orbit.

name: CartoSat-2
description: Advanced remote sensing satellite

name: SRE-1
description: An experimental satellite that was launched as a co-passenger with CARTOSAT-2.

name: INSAT-4B
description: Identical to INSAT-4A.

name: INSAT-4CR
description: Identical to INSAT-4C.

name: CartoSat-2A
description: Identical to CARTOSAT-2.

name: IMS-1
description: Low-cost microsatellite imaging mission. Launched as co-passenger with CARTOSAT-2A.

name: Chandrayaan-1
description: India's first unmanned lunar probe.

name: RISAT-2
description: Radar imaging satellite. Launched as a co-passenger with ANUSAT.

name: AnuSat-1
description: Research micro-satellite. It has since been retired.

name: OceanSat-2
description: Continues mission of OceanSat-1.

name: GSAT-4
description: Communications satellite with technology demonstrator features. Failed to achieve orbit.

name: CartoSat-2B
description: Identical to CartoSat-2A.

name: StudSat
description: India's first pico-satellite (weighing less than 1 kg).

name: GSAT-5P
description: C-band communication satellite. Failed to achieve the mission.

name: ResourceSat-2
description: Identical to ResourceSat-1.

name: YouthSat
description: Indo-Russian stellar and atmospheric mini-satellite.

name: GSAT-8 or INSAT-4G
description: Communications Satellite

name: GSAT-12
description: Augmented the capacity of the INSAT system for various communication services.

name: Megha-Tropiques
description: Jointly developed by ISRO and the French CNES.

name: Jugnu
description: Nano-satellite developed by IIT Kanpur.

name: SRMSat
description: Nano-satellite developed by SRM Institute of Science and Technology.

name: RISAT-1
description: India's first indigenous all-weather Radar Imaging Satellite.

name: GSAT-10
description: India's advanced communication satellite.

name: SARAL
description: Joint Indo-French satellite mission for oceanographic studies.

name: IRNSS-1A
description: The first of seven satellites in the IRNSS navigational system.

name: INSAT-3D
description: It is a meteorological Satellite with advanced weather monitoring payloads.

name: GSAT-7
description: It is the advanced multi-band communication satellite dedicated to military use.

name: Mars Orbiter Mission (MOM) or Mangalyaan-1
description: India's first Mars orbiter.

name: GSAT-14
description: Intended to replace GSAT-3, and to augment the in-orbit capacity of Extended C and Ku-band transponders.

name: IRNSS-1B
description: It is the second of seven satellites in the IRNSS system.

name: IRNSS-1C
description: It is the third satellite in the IRNSS.

name: GSAT-16
description: It has the highest number of transponders in a single satellite at that time (48 transponders).

name: IRNSS-1D
description: It is the fourth satellite in the IRNSS.

name: GSAT-6
description: Communication satellite that marks the success of indigenously developed upper stage cryogenic engine.

name: Astrosat
description: India's first dedicated multi-wavelength space observatory.

name: GSAT-15
description: Communications satellite.

name: IRNSS-1E
description: It is the fifth satellite in the IRNSS.

name: IRNSS-1F
description: It is the sixth satellite in the IRNSS.

name: IRNSS-1G
description: It is the seventh satellite in the IRNSS.

name: Cartosat-2C
description: Identical to CARTOSAT-2,2A and 2B.

name: SathyabamaSat
description: A micro-satellite designed and built by Sathyabama University, Chennai.

name: Swayam-1
description: A 1-U pico-satellite designed and built by the students of College of Engineering, Pune.

name: INSAT-3DR
description: An advanced meteorological satellite

name: Pratham
description: A mini-satellite build by students and researchers at IIT, Mumbai.

name: PISat
description: A micro-satellite designed and built by the students of PES Institute of Technology, Bengaluru.

name: ScatSat-1
description: Miniature satellite to provide weather forecasting, cyclone prediction, and tracking services to India.

name: GSAT-18
description: The heaviest satellite owned by India at the time of its launch.

name: ResourceSat-2A
description: Identical to Resourcesat-1 and Resourcesat-2.

name: CartoSat-2D
description: ISRO holds the world record for launching the highest number of satellites by a single launch vehicle.

name: INS-1A
description: One of 2 nano-satellites designed and manufactured by ISRO, as part of the constellation of 104 satellites launched in a single go.

name: INS-1B
description: One of 2 nano-satellites designed and manufactured by ISRO, as part of the constellation of 104 satellites launched in a single go.

name: South Asia Satellite
description: It is offered by India as a diplomatic initiative to its neighbouring countries (SAARC region) for communication, remote sensing, resource mapping and disaster management applications.

name: GSAT-19
description: It is the heaviest rocket (and the heaviest satellite) to be launched by ISRO from Indian soil.

name: NIUSat
description: It is built by the students of Noorul Islam University, Kanyakumari.

name: CartoSat-2E
description: 7th satellite in the Cartosat series to be built by ISRO.

name: GSAT-17
description: India's 18th communication (and to date, its heaviest) satellite

name: IRNSS-1H
description: First satellite to be co-designed and built-in collaboration with private sector assistance. Failed to achieve orbit.

name: CartoSat-2F
description: 6th satellite in the Cartosat series to be built by ISRO.

name: MicroSat-TD
description: It is a technology demonstrator and the forerunner for future satellites in this series.

name: INS-1C
description: Third satellite in the Indian Nanosatellite series. It will carry MMX-TD Payload from SAC.

name: GSAT-6A
description: A high power S-band communication satellite. It will also provide a platform for developing technologies.

name: IRNSS-II
description: Eighth satellite of IRNSS.

name: GSAT-29
description: High-throughput Communication Satellite

name: HySIS
description: Hyperspectral imaging services for agriculture, forestry, resource mapping, geographical assessment and military applications.

name: ExseedSat-1
description: India's first privately funded and built satellite.

name: GSAT-11
description: Heaviest Indian spacecraft in orbit to date.

name: GSAT-7A
description: Services for IAF and Indian Army.

name: Microsat-R
description: Suspected to have been destroyed in the 2019 Indian anti-satellite missile test.

name: PS4 Stage attached with KalamSAT-V2
description: Used PSLV's 4th stage as an orbital platform.

name: GSAT-31
description: Replacement of the ageing INSAT-4CR.

name: EMISAT
description: Electromagnetic intelligence to track any enemy radars for IAF.

name: PS4 Stage attached with ExseedSat-2, AMSAT, ARIS and AIS payloads
description: Utilization of the fourth stage directly as a satellite for experiments.

name: RISAT-2B
description: Successor to old RISAT-2.

name: Orbiter of Chandrayaan-2
description: India's second lunar exploration mission.

name: Cartosat-3
description: One of the optical satellites with the highest resolutions in the world.

name: RISAT-2BR1
description: Improved resolution of 0.35 metres.

name: GSAT-30
description: Replacement of INSAT-4A.

name: EOS-01
description: Space-based synthetic aperture imaging radar.

name: CMS-01
description: Extended C-band coverage for mainland India, Lakshadweep and Andaman & Nicobar Islands.
